Key Match Events: The Mets lost 10-2 in Game 4 of the NLCS, putting them one game from elimination.
Jose Quintana struggled against the Dodgers, allowing multiple runs in critical counts.
Mookie Betts hit a two-run double to extend the Dodgers' lead to 5-2.
Pre-Game Insights: Francisco Alvarez highlighted the confidence manager Carlos Mendoza instills in the players.
Mendoza emphasized the importance of Jose Quintana getting ahead in counts against the Dodgers.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso stressed the need for the Mets to be better and apply lessons from the first four games.
Carlos Mendoza reflected on the need for urgency in the postseason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have scored 30 runs in the series, with 14 coming against a starter the third time through or a long man out of the bullpen.
The Mets have issued 31 walks in four games.
